page.title: 11Farming, Buxton (continued).
page.content: Class 9 of Fairfield Endowed School visited the farms in the Fairfield area. We discovered that Nunsfield Farm had rented out its 60 acres to a neighbouring farmer for the grazing of dairy cows. The Barms Farm has 100 acres. Dairy cows are kept. Grass is cut for silage and kept in a tower. The farm has three workers. It has tractors,and a harvester. Bradley's Farm is a small farm, keeping 700 pigs and 11,300 chickens and it has one full time worker and one part time worker. The farm is mainly buildings and has liitle land attached to it. It has a tractor and an animal transporter. Garden House is a farm of 32.5 acres and rears bullocks. It has two full time workers and one part time worker. There are two tractors on this farm.
